summary: This is a forwarded email from the chambers of Judge Alison J. Nathan to counsel in the case US v. Maxwell (20cr330), notifying them that due to an unmovable conflict requiring the judge to be outside the district, the trial will not be held on December 13, 14, and 15, 2021. The judge will inform the jury the following day.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Judge Nathan is the presiding judge in the case US v. Maxwell (20cr330) and is notifying counsel of a scheduling conflict requiring her to be out of the district, resulting in trial cancellation on specific dates.

events.title: Trial Scheduling Notification
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan's chambers notifies counsel that due to an unmovable conflict requiring the judge to be outside the district, the trial in US v. Maxwell will not be held on December 13, 14, and 15, 2021.

events.title: Trial Cancellation Days
events.description: The trial in US v. Maxwell is cancelled on these dates due to Judge Nathan's scheduling conflict.

keyFacts: The document is a court communication regarding the scheduling of the trial in US v. Maxwell (case 20cr330).
Judge Alison J. Nathan had an unmovable conflict requiring her to be outside the district on December 13-15, 2021, leading to the cancellation of trial on those days.
The judge planned to inform the jury of the cancellation the day after this email was sent (December 3, 2021).
